snippet: Concerns for the president’s security prompted the decision, which came as West African leaders planned to meet in Paris to discuss the insurgency of the group that took the girls.
abstract: First visit by Nigerian Pres Goodluck Jonathan to Chibok, Nigeria, village from which nearly 300 girls were abducted by Boko Haram, is abruptly canceled because of security fears.

byline.original: By ADAM NOSSITER and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Adam Nossiter reported from Maiduguri, and Alan Cowell from London. Maïa de la Baume contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Concerns for the president’s security prompted the decision, which came as West African leaders planned to meet in Paris to discuss the insurgency of the group that took the girls.

headline.main: Nigerian Leader Cancels Visit to Village of Abducted Girls
headline.print_headline: Nigerian Leader Cancels Visit to Village of Abducted Girls
